raw_response: {"answer_index": 2, "answer_text": "C", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "This patient has episodic headaches, palpitations, hypertension, diaphoresis, and pallor—classic symptoms of pheochromocytoma. Pheochromocytomas are catecholamine-secreting tumors derived from chromaffin cells of the adrenal medulla. On histology, region C would correspond to the adrenal medulla, where chromaffin cells reside and produce catecholamines (epinephrine, norepinephrine).", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
